lines.text: Tell me something, my friend. You ever dance with the devil in the pale moonlight?
What?
I always ask that of all my prey. I just... like the sound of it.
[shoots him]
What do you want?
My face on the one dollar bill.
You must be joking.
Do I look like I'm joking?
Where does he get those wonderful toys?
Never rub another man's rhubarb.
[Batman dangles a mugger over the side of a building]
Don't kill me! Don't kill me, man! Don't kill me! Don't kill me, man!
I'm not going to kill you. I want you to do me a favor. I want you to tell all your friends about me.
What are you?
I'm Batman.
I know who you are. Let me tell you about this guy I know, Jack. Mean kid. Bad seed. Hurt people.
I like him already.
[laughs]
Now you know the problem was... he got sloppy. You know? Crazy. He started to lose it. He had a head full of bad wiring, I guess.
[Walks towards the fireplace]
Couldn't keep it straight up here.
[Points to his head]
He was the kind of guy who couldn't hear the train until it was 2 feet from him.
Hmm.
[Smiles and nods his head]
You know what happened to this guy, Jack?
[Shakes his head]
Well... he made mistakes. Then he had his
[grabs a poker and smashes a vase]
LIGHTS OUT! Now you wanna get nuts? Come on! Let's get nuts.

[distracting Joker]
Mr. Joker, you say such beautiful things. Oh, you're so powerful. And purple! Oh, I love purple.
Excuse me.
[Joker looks]
Have you ever danced with the devil in the pale moonlight?
[punches him]

[fuming]
Batman... Batman... Can somebody tell me what kind of a world we live in, where a man dressed up as a *bat* gets all of my press? This town needs an enema!

[reciting his poem to Vicki]
I'm only laughing on the outside / My smile is just skin deep / If you could see inside I'm really crying / You might join me for a weep.
A lot of people think you're as dangerous as the Joker.
He's psychotic.
Some people say the same thing about you.
What people?
Well, I mean, let's face it. You're not exactly normal, are you?
It's not exactly a normal world, is it?

[talking to a gargoyle]
What are you laughin' at?
I'm going to kill you!
You IDIOT! You made me. Remember? You dropped me into that vat of chemicals. That wasn't easy to get over, and don't think that I didn't try.
I know you did.
[punches him again]
Haven't you ever heard of the healing power of laughter?
The pen, is truly mightier than the sword!
I now do what other people only dream. I make art until someone dies. See? I am the world's first fully functioning homicidal artist.
That you, sugar bumps?
[turns around to see a man]
Who the hell are you?
It's me, Sugar bumps.
Jack? Oh, oh, thank God you're alive! I heard you'd been...
Fried? Is that what you heard? You set me up over a woman. A *woman*! You must be insane.
[Grissom goes for his gun]
Don't bother.
Your life won't be worth spit!
I've been dead once already. It's very liberating. You should think of it as, uh... therapy.
Jack, listen. Maybe we can cut a deal.
Jack? Jack is dead, my friend.
[steps into the light]
You can call me... Joker. And as you can see, I'm a lot happier.
[laughs, and then proceeds to kill Grissom]
if you gotta go, go with a smile.
And now, folks, it's time for "Who do you trust!" Hubba, hubba, hubba! Money, money, money! Who do you trust? Me? I'm giving away free money. And where is the Batman? HE'S AT HOME WASHING HIS TIGHTS!
Sometimes I just kill myself!
[to Rotelli's charred and smoldering corpse]
Your pals, uh, they're not bad people. Maybe we, uh, outta give them a couple of days to think it over.
[shakes head]
No?
[looks surprised]
Grease 'em now? Well, OK. You are a vicious bastard Rotelli, and, uh, I'm glad you're dead!
You're insane!
I thought I was a Pisces.
I have no wish to fill my few remaining years grieving for the loss of old friends. Or their sons.
You know what they say? They say he can't be killed. They say he drinks blood. They say...
I say... you're full of shit, Knox. Oh, uh, you can quote me on that.
So gentlemen, that's how it is. Until Grissom, uh resurfaces, I'm the acting President, and I say starting with this anniversary festival, we run the city into the ground.
Why don't we hear this from Grissom?
Yeah. And what's with that stupid grin?
Life's been good to me.
What if we say no?
Well, Tony, nobody wants a war. If we can't do business, why, we'll just shake hands and that'll be it.
Yeah?
Yeah.
[Rotelli shakes hands with The Joker and starts to get electrocuted]
Whoo! Whoo! Oh, I got a live one here.
[the Joker starts to laugh hysterically, as Rotelli catches fire]

[singing]
Oh, there'll be a hot time in the old town tonight.
[the Joker drops Rotelli, charred to a crisp, into his seat]

[fanning away the smoke with his hat]
Antoine got a little "hot" under the collar.
You're crazy.
Haven't you ever heard of the healing power of laughter?
[He begins to laugh again and mops sweat from his brow, exposing a patch of chalk-white flesh]
NOW GET OUTTA HERE!
As though we were made for each other... Beauty and the Beast. Of course, if anyone else calls you beast, I'll rip their lungs out.
You're insane!
I thought I was a Pisces!

[Vicki goes to answer the front door; mouths]
I'm Batman, I'm Batman.
I have given a name to my pain, and it is Batman.
I've recently had a tragedy in my life. Alicia...
[lays the mask that Alicia wore on the table]
...threw herself out of the window.
Oh, my God.
But, you can't make an omelette without breaking some eggs.
[breaks the mask and starts giggling]

We've received a letter from Batman this morning. 'Please inform the citizens of Gotham that Gotham City has earned a rest from crime. But if the forces of evil should rise again, to cast a shadow on the heart of the city, call me.'
Question. How do we call him?
He gave us a signal.
[Commissioner Gordon activates the Bat Signal]
You killed my parents.
What? What? What are you talking about?
I made you, you made me first.
Hey, bat-brain, I mean, I was a kid when I killed your parents. I mean, I say "I made you" you gotta say "you made me." I mean, how childish can you get?
My balloons. Those are my balloons. He stole my balloons! Why didn't somebody tell me he had one of those... things? Bob, gun.
[Bob hands him a gun, Joker shoots him]
I'm gonna need a minute or two alone, boys.
Bob, I want you to go down to the globe. Follow that reporter Knox. Take your camera. See what he knows about this Batman. And Bob...
[imitates Grisson]
Remember... you... are my number one... guy!
You're a real nice girl, and I like you a lot, but right now, shut up.
[Joker gives someone a hand and electrocutes him]
Oh, I got a live one here!
You weigh a little more than a hundred and eight.
Oh really!
Let's go.
It can be truly said, that I have a bat in my belfry.
[laughs]
Shall we dance?
What's with that stupid grin?
Life's been good to me.
[reaches for a pair of glasses in his pocket and puts them on]
You wouldn't hit a guy with glasses on, would you? Huh?
[Batman punches him]
They don't make 'em like they used to! Do they, eh? Eh, Batsy?
I'm of a mind to make some mookie.
[about one of his suits of armor]
It's Japanese.
How do you know?
Because I bought it in Japan.

[examining Vicki's work]
Crap... crap... crap... crap...
[sees pictures of war victims]
Ah! Now that's good work! The skulls... the bodies... you give it all such a glow! I don't know if it's art, but I like it!
He's really wonderful? He loves you a lot.
Alfred's a great one. I Couldn't find my socks without him.

[Talking to Bob]
You
[heavy breathing]
are my number one
[heavy breathing]
guy.
Bruce... Wayne, n'est-ce pas?
Most of the time.
Gotham City. Always brings a smile to my face.
[the Joker sees a picture of Vicki Vale]
Stop the press, who is that?
Smylex.
[Jack is primping in front of a mirror]
You look fine.
I didn't ask.
[the Batwing is flying at Joker]
Come on, you gruesome son of a bitch! Come to me. Ha ha ha ha ha ha! Come on!
[Joker reads the newspaper]
"Winged freak terrorizes"? Wait till they get a load of me!
See that thing on my belt? Grab it! Whatever you do, don't let go.
You wanna get nuts? Come on! Let's get nuts!
It's time to retire! Feel free to drop in.
[upon entering the museum]
Gentlemen! Let's broaden our minds. Lawrence?
[Alicia sees Jack as the Joker for the first time]
Honey, you'll never believe what happened to me today.
[Alicia faints]
Huh.
[chuckles]
What can I do for you?
Oh, little song, little dance. Batman's head on a lance.
Gotham City Cathedral, transportation for two.
Right away, sir?
Five minutes.
Five minutes.
[Joker raises his head to look at the top of the Cathedral]
Better make it ten.

[speaking across the entire dining room table]
Could you pass the salt?
Let him go, or I'll do Gordon.
Mr. Dent, I love that tie. We were discussing the pros and cons of winged vigilantes. What's your stand?
Mr. Knox, we have enough problems in this city without worrying about ghosts or goblins.
Pardon me, but that's not a denial.
We've been ratted out here, boys.
The rich. You know why they're so odd? Because they can afford to be.
Eckheardt! think a bout the future!

[Bob brings Alicia in]
Jack, you said I could watch you improve the paintings.
Well I'm in trouble now.

[sees Bruce Wayne enter the room]
Well, Miss Vale, another rooster in the henhouse.

[after shooting Bruce Wayne]
Why is it everytime I come for you somebody always gets in the way?
Aww! He took the film!
Hey, let's beat it, man. I don't like it up here.
What are ya, scared of heights?
I don't know. After what happened to Johnny Gobs...
Hey, look, man. Johnny Gobs got ripped and took a walk off a roof, all right? No big loss.
No man... that ain't what I heard at all. I heard that the Bat got him.
The Bat? Aw man, give me a break, will ya?
Five stories straight down. There wasn't no blood in the body.
No shit. It was all over the pavement.
[Jack Napier is confronted with Batman for the first time]
Nice outfit!
I just gotta know, are we gonna try to love each other?
I'd like to. But he's out there right now. And I've gotta go to work.
Who is that loss?
It's Knox.
Bad tie.
Let me tell you about this guy I know. Jack. Mean kid. Bad seed. Hurt people.
I like him already.
[after revealling his latest "work", Alicia]
Well, I'm no Picasso, but do you like it?
Antoine got a little hot under the collar.
We've got a flying mouse to kill, and I wanna clean my claws.
Jack, it's an important job. I need... someone I can trust. You are my number one guy!
Have you shipped a million of those things?
Yes sir!
Ship 'em ALL! We're gonna take 'em out a WHOLE NEW DOOR!

[seeing Vicki for the first time]
Hello legs!
[first lines]
Excuse me.
I'm sorry, this is my cab.
Sorry.
Listen, I was here first!
[as the cab drives away]
Oh, God! Oh, taxi? Taxi!
Why, Eckhardt, you oughta think about the future.
You mean when you run this show? You ain't got no future, Jack! You're an A-1 nut boy and Grissom knows it!
[Jack pushes Eckhardt against the wall, and Eckhardt whips out his gun. Bob steps up from behind Jack with his gun pointed at Eckhardt]
Better be sure.
[Eckhardt's lowers his gun]
See? You can make a good decision when you try.
[he chuckles as he and Bob walk away]
Into the air, Junior Birdman! Missed me!
Hello, Vinny. It's your Uncle Bingo. Time to pay the check!
Joker here.
We got interference. Call the OB unit, will ya?

Now you fellas have said some pretty mean things. Some of which *were* true under that fiend, Boss Grissom. He *was* a thief, and a terrorist. On the other hand he had a tremendous singing voice. He's dead now, and he's left me in charge. Now, I can be theatrical, and maybe even a little rough - but one thing I am not, is a *killer*. I am an artist. I *love* a good party. So, truce. Commence au festival!
Y'see, my life is really... complex.
Miss Vale called again. Dare I suggest that your present course of action might simply strengthen her resolve. She is quite tenacious.
You're right about that.
And if I may say so, quite special. Perhaps you could try telling her the truth.
Lieutenant, is there a six-foot bat in Gotham City? And if so, is he on the police payroll? And if so, what's he pulling down... after taxes?

[shows up unexpectedly at Vicki's place]
Miss me? Nice place you've got here. Lots of space. Uh, Vicki, we've really got to have a talk. I'm very upset. We were having dinner. I was a man doing well with a beautiful woman. And without so much as an apology, you ran off with that sideshow phony.
Decent people shouldn't live here. They'd be happier someplace else.
Pretty tough talk about Carl.
Don't worry about it. If this clown could touch Grissom, I'd have handed him his lungs by now.
If Grissom knew about us, he might hand you something.
Don't flatter yourself, angel. He's a tired old man. He can't run this city without me. And besides, he doesn't know.
[Last lines]
I thought champagne would be in order, ma'am.
Hi, Alfred.
Mr. Wayne told me to tell you that he might be a little late.
I'm not a bit surprised.
Darling, I've got to get you to the church on time.
Any man who opens fire on Jack Napier will answer to me!
I'm reading your stuff.
Well, I'm reading yours.
Hi! I'm Vicki Vale.
At midnight, I will dump twenty million in cash on the crowd. Don't worry about me, I've got enough.
We are not prepared to discuss any deals.

[pushes the Mayor off the TV]
You heard it folks. Twenty million.
Maybe it should be Bruce Vain!
"Man, let's go! Let's go, Jack!"
Brought you a little snack, Eckhardt.
[it's a wad of bills between two pieces of bread]
Why don't you broadcast it?
Shut up and listen.

[observing one of Wayne's odd sculptures]
Check this out! He must have been "King of the Wicker People".
What about *your* family?
Well, actually, Alfred is my family.
You know, this house and all this stuff really doesn't seem like you at all.
Some of it is very much me. Some of it isn't.
[last lines]
Oh, I regret to inform you that master Wayne is going to be a little late tonight.

[grinning]
I'm not at all surprised.
Commissioner Gordon, is there a six foot bat operating in Gotham City, and is he on the police payroll, and if so... what's he pulling down... after taxes?
